net.markenwerk.utils.text.fetcher

Class AbstractBufferedTextFetcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.markenwerk.utils.text.fetcher.AbstractTextFetcher
      • net.markenwerk.utils.text.fetcher.AbstractBufferedTextFetcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TextFetcher
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BufferedTextFetcher

    public abstract class AbstractBufferedTextFetcher
extends AbstractTextFetcher
    AbstractBufferedTextFetcher is a sensible base implementation of TextFetcher that uses a char[] as buffer, to while copying all chars from an Reader to an Writer by sequentially reading from the Reader into the buffer and then writing from the buffer to the Writer.

    If doCopy(Reader, Writer, TextFetchProgressListener) is called with a Reader and a Writer, which should be the most common case, the char[] buffer is used directly, otherwise a CharBuffer is wrapped around the char[] buffer.

    Implementers must only implement the methods obtainBuffer() and returnBuffer(char[]) that manage a char[] to be used as a buffer in doCopy(Reader, Writer, TextFetchProgressListener).

    Implementers may also override returnBuffer(char[]), which is called after doCopy(Reader, Writer, TextFetchProgressListener) has finished using it.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Torsten Krause (tk at markenwerk dot net)

    • Method Detail

      • createBuffer

        protected static final char[] createBuffer(int bufferSize)
        Safely creates a new char[] to be used as a buffer.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - The size of the char[] to be created. Defaults to the default buffer size, if the given buffer size is not positive.
        Returns:
        The new char[].

      • doCopy

        protected final void doCopy(Reader in,
                            Writer out,
                            TextFetchProgressListener listener)
                     throws TextFetchException
        Description copied from class: AbstractTextFetcher
        Copies the content of a given Readable into a given Appendable.

        It is guaranteed that neither the given Readable nor the given Appendable nor the given TextFetchProgressListener is null.

        Implementers must not close either of the given streams.

        Specified by:
        doCopy in class AbstractTextFetcher
        Parameters:
        in - The Readable to read from.
        out - The Appendable to write to.
        listener - The TextFetchProgressListener to report to.
        Throws:
        TextFetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given Readable or writing to the given Appendable.

      • obtainBuffer

        protected abstract char[] obtainBuffer()
        Called by doCopy(Reader, Writer, TextFetchProgressListener) to obtain a char[] to be used as a buffer.

        Every char[] that is returned by this method will be passed as an argument of returnBuffer(char[]) after doCopy(Reader, Writer, TextFetchProgressListener) has finished using it.

        Returns:
        The a char[] to be used as a buffer.

      • returnBuffer

        protected abstract void returnBuffer(char[] buffer)
        Called by doCopy(Reader, Writer, TextFetchProgressListener) to return a char[] that has previously been obtained from obtainBuffer().
        Parameters:
        buffer - The char[] to be returned.
